subject: Packaging: improve rpmlint score
commitMessage:
Packaging: improve rpmlint score

* Remove init scripts.
* Properly manage licenses.
* Remove unnecessary dependencies.
* Add missing calls to ldconfig.
* Use rpm macros.

Change-Id: I6d5843ccb2b4d623bc28323fc47faa8ae69c94c5
Signed-off-by: Kévin THIERRY <kevin.thierry@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Re-enabled asynchronous updates to mail items through the email_update_mail API call.
commitMessage:
Re-enabled asynchronous updates to mail items through the email_update_mail API call.

if __FEATURE_SYNC_CLIENT_TO_SERVER__ is disabled in your build, then all update_mail
calls will execute synchronously, bypassing the event loop. You can also execute
update_mail synchronously at any time by passing sync_server/input_from_eas parameter to 1
in ur emdaemon_update_mail() calls.

Change-Id: I368485e82429dd8dfcf868d2a40c3277596517ad

subject: Comment from Casey Schaufler:  "This change was merged within minutes of being submitted and absolutely breaks the Smack model for Tizen 3. This should never have gone in. Because it was merged so quickly there was no opportunity for real review." Revert

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Reverting this change.

subject: notification: add account notification flag
commitMessage:
notification: add account notification flag

Add a field to indicate if an account is supposed to emit notifications
for email receiving.

Change-Id: I232d3161a2fcdd27583128b6e66e8d4e1642757e
Signed-off-by: Iván Briano <ivan.briano@intel.com>

subject: Create notifications for each arriving email. Consume then when respective messages are read.
commitMessage:
Create notifications for each arriving email. Consume then when respective messages are read.

Also support unknown contacts (insert them on DB when the sender is
not in the contacts pristine DB).

Change-Id: If7e76afe2e6f9017cc529076480f3c0709bd71d7
Signed-off-by: Iván Briano <ivan.briano@intel.com>

subject: Bug fix: The email service should set the email id in the phonelogs table.
commitMessage:
Bug fix: The email service should set the email id in the phonelogs table.

According to the contacts service the column extra_data1 should contain the email id,
however the email account id was being set in this column,
making it impossible to know exactly which email the entry in the
_contacts_phone_log view is refering to.
To fix this bug, we must set the email id in the column extra_data1.

Change-Id: Ieb7f272766f004d98216849eb274f89d7fb88ee0
Signed-off-by: Iván Briano <ivan.briano@intel.com>

subject: If is a draft email, do not check if the email is valid.
commitMessage:
If is a draft email, do not check if the email is valid.

Change-Id: I17244814abd09a57d19a03655141aa188bf0af35
Signed-off-by: Iván Briano <ivan.briano@intel.com>

subject: Address info was not returning contact id properly.
commitMessage:
Address info was not returning contact id properly.

  - It was returning always '-1'. Fixed.

Change-Id: Ic8189f298ba8692e694f33dfb2dc92e20f657720
Signed-off-by: Iván Briano <ivan.briano@intel.com>

subject: Treat body as 'multipart' only if it is indeed 'multipart'
commitMessage:
Treat body as 'multipart' only if it is indeed 'multipart'

  - At some point of the code, 'Content-Type: multipart' was being inferred
  from body content itself. This is dangerously error prone: if an email
  body contains the word 'Content-Type', it would be treated as
  'multipart' while it really is not (Mail delivery fail emails usually
  have a 'Content-Type' string). Now, this treatment is based on
  header information.

Change-Id: I5cbef988aee14e26751c04dba21d19681667f0a7
Signed-off-by: Iván Briano <ivan.briano@intel.com>
